meanings.definition: A Brazilian dance resembling the tango.
meanings.sent1: During the carnival, Maria performed a lively maxixe with her partner.
meanings.sent2: The dancers moved gracefully to the rhythm of the maxixe music.
meanings.sent3: At the dance competition, the maxixe caused quite a stir with its energetic steps.
meanings.sent4: The maxixe was like a whirlwind of passion on the dance floor.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the costumes added to the excitement of the maxixe performance.

meanings.definition: A spicy condiment made from pickled vegetables.
meanings.sent1: The chef added a dollop of maxixe to the dish for an extra kick of flavor.
meanings.sent2: The sandwich was delicious with a hint of tangy maxixe spread inside.
meanings.sent3: Some people find the spiciness of maxixe quite addictive.
meanings.sent4: The maxixe transformed the bland meal into a culinary adventure.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the maxixe filled the kitchen with warmth and spice.

meanings.definition: A type of African plant with edible tubers.
meanings.sent1: The villagers harvested the maxixe tubers for their evening meal.
meanings.sent2: The leaves of the maxixe plant are also used in traditional medicine.
meanings.sent3: The children enjoyed digging up the maxixe tubers in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The maxixe plant thrived in the rich soil of the African plains.
meanings.sent5: The flavor of the cooked maxixe tubers reminded them of home.
